turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: We at the Banzai Institute have at last found that way: an alternating gradient synchronizer that softens solid matter by attenuating its electroweak forces!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Which we all know are the forces that tend to pull objects part, right, professor?

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: Buckaroo!  What the Sam Hill!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Careful...don't make noise and don't touch me.  I'm hotter than flapjacks.

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I'm a giant semi-conductor, and there's alien creatures all around us. Form the Eighth Dimension, I think.  Look...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Ever since that phony phone call from the President.  Look at this. What is it?

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: It's your hand, Buckaroo.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: It's an antidote. A formula.  Whoever it was on the phone made me scribble this and gave me the ability to penetrate their disguises.

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: Antidote to what?  Whose disguises?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Arachtoids.  From Planet Ten.

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: Planet 10?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: There's a Harley behind those bushes.  Get back to the laboratory and start working on the formula.  We don't have time to ask questions. Just synthesize it-

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I'm starving...somebody, help.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Got a half a tuna sandwich.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Same one you had yesterday?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Vanished. Thin air.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Dr. Lizardo's a raving lunatic, Perfect Tommy, a vicious psychopath with crazy eyes and flaming orange hair that once upon a time was mousy brown like yours.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Have you warned Professor Hikita?

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: First thing I did.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: The professor and Dr. Emilio Lizardo were actually the first to discover the Eighth Dimension.  Almost fifty years ago.  Before Buckaroo's parents even knew each other.  But there was trouble, a rocket catapult failed and Dr. Lizardo got sucked half in, half out...when they hauled him back ,he wasn't the same guy.  His hair was orange...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: And his soul black as the Ace of Spades.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: He went on a senseless crime spree, killed a cop during a bank robbery, got caught and judged insane.  The professor told us they threw away the key.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Go back to the bus and reroute the call.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: And try the President's private number at the hospital.  Make sure this is on the level. We're busy people here.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: That's me. I've been ionized, but I'm okay. I'm, switching on the homing beacon, mark two minute intervals.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Buckaroo, somebody shanghaied the Professor!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: The deuce you say.  That crate!

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: What crate?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I think I'm on to something. You and the guys go back to the house and dig up everything you can on an outfit called Yoyodyne.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems?  You think they're mixed up in this?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Yeah. Just grazed me.  The Professor's under the floor too...with the Overthruster...

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: You're a welcome sight...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Just 'grazed' you, huh?

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Apache?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Arachtoid.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: So I was right.  That's nice to know...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: We will, old fried, we will.

turns.speaker: RAWHIDE
turns.text: Sure do pack a mean wallop...let's go...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Anybody we know?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Who put this dirty picture in Buckaroo's viewer?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Buckaroo, you got a minute--?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Not really.  This is pretty important.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: She wants a picture.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Everybody ready?  How do we look?  Do we look okay?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: I look great.  Let's rock 'n' roll.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, any lock can be picked.  So what's he up to?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I'm sure we'll find out soon enough.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Running a little late, Buckaroo.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Let her out. In my custody.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Let her out?  She's a killer.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Planet 10?  The same Planet 10 you postulated beyond Pluto, Perfect Tommy?  The invisible body?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Yeah, but most of 'em blasted in through the Eighth Dimension in 1938 at Grover's Mills, New Jersey...

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: It wouldn't tell us the whole story until you got here.  It wasn't to talk to the head honcho.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: It?  Who does?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Buckaroo--! Sorry--

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: What is it, Tommy?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Sam's dead!  Someone broke into the Jet Car! And things are going haywire over at the lab...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Dead.  Damnit!

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Where's the professor?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: It's Whorfin, Buckaroo.  Line 3.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Whorfin?  Does he know we're coming?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: All accounted for?  Where's Penny?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: New Jersey brought her back to the bus through heavy fire.  Quite a guy if you want my opinion.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: These antidote filters the Professor's whipped up will let you to see them like I have since yesterday, as arachtoidal creatures. They won't be pretty, nothing personal, John Parker.  But just remember...if we fail tonight, there's no tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JOHN PARKER
turns.text: They will never surrender.  They will fight to the end.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: What is this thing?  A fighter?

turns.speaker: JOHN PARKER
turns.text: Don't look at me, Buckaroo Banzai.  I failed flight school.

turns.speaker: JOHN PARKER
turns.text: We're going down!  Onto the runway!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: The door's locked.

turns.speaker: JOHN PARKER
turns.text: I lack the authority, Buckaroo Banzai.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: At least tell them I'm trying!  Tell 'em something--!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Does this thing have guns, John Parker?

turns.speaker: JOHN PARKER
turns.text: Boy, I hope so, Buckaroo Banzai.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Pull up!  We did it!  Holy shit, we did it!  Pull up!

turns.speaker: JOHN PARKER
turns.text: Now, Buckaroo Banzai?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Now!

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: And there's a two-hundred-dollar deductible we have to eat on that crack in her windshield.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Figures.  Anybody seen my scope?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: They're arachtoids, Buckaroo, from Planet 10!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: What? How do you know that?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: ...where there was some kinda giant crash landing, a huge explosion and they fooled Orson Welles into covering it up!  And then they founded Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems and hid there for...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Orson Wells?  What about Doctor Lizardo?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: ...but he wasn't the real Doctor Lizardo...just this arachtoid creep that stole the good doc's body the year before in the Eighth Dimension when Prof. Hikita's lab exploded...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Stole his body?  When Doctor Lizardo's hair turned red and his mind snapped?  Of course!  What else?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Where're you goin'?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: To get my guns.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: And they got Penny!  Look!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Don't shoot!

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: They're armed for bear, Buckaroo.  Check out those radiation levels.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: John Parker, tell them we're doing our best.  Stall.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Got a casualty list?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Just their side.  What're we gonna do with these people?  They're illegal aliens, the way I figure, been here forty years, you could throw the book at 'em...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: And ask the American taxpayer to foot the bill?  No way.  Send 'em back to the Eighth Dimension as soon as we find the Overthruster.  It wasn't in Penny's purse...so if we have to run this joint upside down and inside out...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Raise your hand...where?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: This is so embarrassing...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Somebody get her a mike? Can we manage that?  And a spotlight.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Penny.  I'd rather not reveal my last name or my age.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Did you say..."Peggy"?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: My name is Penny. Penny Priddy.  There I've said it, but it won't mean anything to you.  I'm a nobody.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Nobody's a nobody.  Why're you crying?  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Did I say anything was wrong? I just sponged up a little too much Vat 69, okay? I'm down to my last nickel in this lousy town, I can't get my luggage outta hock 'cause I met this jerk who said he was a record producer when all he had was a record.  He offered to set me up for life, and like a fool, well, I...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: He offered you money?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Do I look like that kinda girl?  I lost my room this morning.  I don't know where I'm gonna sleep tonight, but I keep going.  What the hell else can I do?  I've still got my figure, and like this bozo said, as long as there's a sidewalk, I'll always have a job.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: This song's for Peggy.  And all you others out there a little down on your luck.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: My name's, Penny!  But who cares?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Let me go, let me go, you creeps...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Everybody okay up here?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: What're you doing here? Why're you looking at me like that?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I guess 'cause you remind me of someone I once knew, long ago before any of this craziness.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Go away.  Let me rot?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Who were you really trying to kill last night?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: You.  Like the papers all say.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Pretty terrible shot.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Was she pretty?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: The girl I remind you of.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: She was the Queen of the Netherlands.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: It's kinda hard this way.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I'd turn around, but I'm afraid you'd strangle me.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: The Netherlands.  Whew, that's a long way from Wyoming.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Wyoming? Not Cody, by any chance?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: No.  Laramie.  Except I was born in Cody. How did you know that?  Oh, right, sure, I forgot: you know everything.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Having a little trouble with that knot, aren't you?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Which?  The one in my throat.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Did you have family there--? A sister?  In Cody?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: I don't know. I always felt like I did, like there was another me...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Another 'you'?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Somewhere.  See I was taken away by the Priddies when I was a baby.  I was adopted.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Adopted.  I should have know. Of course. If it was a snake, it'd bit me!

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: What?  I don't understand you.  I don't understand anything anymore.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Who does?  It's a crazy mixed-up world.  Just do the best you can with what you have...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: You keep an eye on it.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Any time.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Open up or I'll shoot it off.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: I'll shoot yours off if I had a gun, you double-dealing Casanova!  I thought you liked me for myself.  But why should you, huh?  A jerk like me.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: She must've been a bigger fool than me if she ran out on a guy like you...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: She was killed, Penny.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Oh, my.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Don't go to pieces.  I haven't got time tonight.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Looks like you're the one might go to pieces.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Where's my damn ammo?  Nothing is ever where it's supposed to be around here!

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: How did she die?  I wanna know.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: You don't wanna know.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Yes, I do.  Gimme a chance.  I'm stronger than you think.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: She was murdered by Hanoi Shan on our wedding night.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Hanoi Shan--?  The guy in your comic books.  Boss of the World Crime League?  Supreme Commander of the Legion of Death?  The Pivot of Mystery himself?  You're putting me on.  He's a cartoon character.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I wish he was.  He's real enough.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: I gotta be honest with myself and not repress these feelings-I've got mixed emotions-I don't know if I can handle this.  Oh, boy...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I gotta go.  We're on borrowed time.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Go where?  Where're you going?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Please, Penny.  You just gotta trust me now.  Okay?  And don't panic. Because it's gonna be all right.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: What?  If we just believe in Buckaroo Banzai?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Yeah...and maybe more important, if you believe in yourself.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Believe in Penny Priddy?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: You've got your six guns strapped on.  You're ridding off on another adventure?  Oh, my God, it's all real...it really is real.  I should go with you.  Please...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: It's too dangerous.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: That's just what you would say.  This is so unreal.  I'm dreaming...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Stay here, I'll be back.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Sure.  I won't hold my breath.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: I'm not worth it, Buckaroo! Forget me!

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Penny--?!  Are you all right?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: World Watch One.  Direct incoming transmission.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI ON TV
turns.text: Hello, Mr. President.  How's my favorite patient?  Any tenderness?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger, Buckaroo.  What's it like out there in the real world?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI ON TV
turns.text: Not too terrific, sir.  I apologize for the interruption but something very unusual has reared its ugly head in outer space, and it looks like the Earth's caught in a crossfire.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: You're gonna have to repeat that, I think, Buckaroo.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI ON TV
turns.text: ...hit Smolensk and precipitate a thermonuclear war, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI ON TV
turns.text: A thermonuclear holocaust, sir.  These creatures from Planet 10 are ready to exploit Soviet-American tensions and get us to blow each other off the face of the earth, sir, if necessary.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: You're quite serious about this, aren't you, Buckaroo.  We know each other pretty well, I think.

turns.speaker: JOHN O'CONNOR
turns.text: What? A black ship?  Where?  A black thermopod's been shot down ten miles back.

turns.speaker: JOHN BIGBOOTÉ
turns.text: A black thermopod here?  On Earth?!  Why, John Gomez?  Why?

turns.speaker: JOHN BIGBOOTÉ
turns.text: Where was it, John O'Connor? How far back?

turns.speaker: JOHN O'CONNOR
turns.text: I have a radio fix...

turns.speaker: JOHN O'CONNOR
turns.text: Not here!  No Overthruster!

turns.speaker: JOHN BIGBOOTÉ
turns.text: John Whorfin will kill us!

turns.speaker: JOHN O'CONNOR
turns.text: You look!  It's not here!

turns.speaker: JOHN O'CONNOR
turns.text: But John Whorfin said kill her.

turns.speaker: JOHN BIGBOOTÉ
turns.text: Damn John Whorfin--!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: Buckaroo, come in...over.  How does this damn thing work?  Can anybody figure this lighter out?

turns.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY MAN
turns.text: No, sir.  I think the flint...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: What's happening with my call to SAC?

turns.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY MAN
turns.text: Still no confirmation either from SAC or Strategic Space Command.  They report all surveillance satellite communication jammed.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: Jammed--? By who? Whom by?

turns.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY MAN
turns.text: Possible atmospheric condition, sir...solar.  It's unusual, but no cause for alarm.  Intelligence reports the Soviets are having the same problem.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT WIDMARK
turns.text: Should we be on Code Red?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: How long you been riding with Buckaroo, Reno?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Nigh on ten years.  Been through a lotta scrapes together.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: What'd you do before?  Can I ask?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Government work.  Had my own think tank.  Got tired of thinking-wanted some action.  Seen plenty of it too.  So will you if you stick around.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Where's Buckaroo?  Is he alive?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Course he's alive.  He's Buckaroo Banzai.

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: What's his problem?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Perfect Tommy's just threatened by smart women.  Can you play that thing?

turns.speaker: PENNY PRIDDY
turns.text: Better than him.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Better see what's keepin' the boss, Reno.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Pick those up, Reno.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: I didn't drop 'em.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: It's a spittin' image.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Doesn't look anything like her to me.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Pictures don't lie.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Hell they don't. I met my first wife that way.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: It's Peggy to these eyes.  Same nose, same hair.  Plus Buckaroo thinks so too or else he wouldn't be ready to go make a fool of himself, right?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Doctor Lizardo. Wasn't he on TV once?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: You're thinking of Mr. Wizard.  This guy's an eccentric genius.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, so was Mr. Wizard.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: The name's Reno.  This here's Perfect Tommy.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Where do you hail from, Doc?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Reno, how's about you take New Jersey's gear, mosey on over to the bus and introduce him to the rest of the hands.

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Cause Buckaroo needs me here.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Any sign of Buckaroo?

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: No!  Ditto the professor-

turns.speaker: RENO
turns.text: We're waiting for the Jet Car.  Billy's bringing it.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Asshole probably got lost.

turns.speaker: TV ANCHORWOMAN
turns.text: So where's Buckaroo?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Whadda you need Buckaroo for?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Unscheduled surgery.  He'll be waltzing along momentarily.  What're you doing tonight?

turns.speaker: TV ANCHORWOMAN
turns.text: Flying to Cambodia.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: That's why I wear a fifty dollar hat.  Was a two hundred dollar hat, I hadda kill you.

turns.speaker: TV ANCHORWOMAN
turns.text: Bet you say that to all the girls, Perfect Tommy.

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: Bet I do.

turns.speaker: TV ANCHORWOMAN
turns.text: Now twenty seconds downrange...Perfect Tommy, how on earth is Buckaroo able to keep that thing on the ground?

turns.speaker: PERFECT TOMMY
turns.text: She's just a damn road hugger, Allison.  Plus the man can drive.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Is, uh... Is he okay?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: He will be... When he can't write, he drinks.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I am sorry, it's so embarassing.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: How about you? Will you be alright?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I'll be fine... Are you a writer, Mr Fink?

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Yes I am. I'm working on a wres  please call me Barton.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I'll tell Bill you dropped by. I'm sure he'll want to reschedule your appointment.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Perhaps you and I could get together at some point also. I'm sorry if that sounds abrupt. I just... I don't know anyone here in this town.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Perhaps the three of us, Mr. Fink.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Please, Barton.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Barton. You see, Barton, I'm not just Bill's secretary  Bill and I are... I love. We-

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: ...I know this must look... funny.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: No, no 

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Let him go.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: That son of a bitch... Don't get me wrong, he's a fine writer.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: ...Oh Barton, I feel so... sorry for him!

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: What?! He's a son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: No, sometimes he just... well, he thinks about Estelle. His wife still lives in Fayettesville. She's... disturbed.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Really?...

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: ...Well that doesn't excuse his behavior.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: He'll wander back when he's sober and apologize. He always does.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Okay, but that doesn't excuse his 

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Barton. Empathy requires... understanding.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: What. What don't I understand?

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Pick it up... Pick it up. Pick it-

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Audrey, listen, I need help. I know it's late and I shouldn't be calling you like this  believe me I wouldn't have if I could see any other alternative, but I  I'm sorry - listen, how are you  I'm sorry. You doing okay?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: ...Who is this?

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Barton. I'm sorry, it's Barton Fink.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: If you could, I'd 

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: If I can. He gets jealous; he-

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Hello, Barton.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Audrey, thank you for coming. Thank you.  I'm sorry to be such a... such a... Thank you.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Now that's all right, Barton. Everything'll be all right.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Yes. Thank you. How's Bill?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Oh, he's... he drifted off. He'll sleep for a while now. What is it you have to do, exactly?

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Well I have to come up with  an outline, I'd guess you call it. The story. The whole goddamn story. Soup to nuts. Three acts. The whole goddamn-

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: It's alright, Barton. You don't have to write actual scenes?

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: No, but the whole goddamn  Audrey? Have you ever had to read any of Bill's wrestling scenarios?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Yes, I'm afraid I have.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: What are they like? What are they about?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Well, usually, they're... simply morality tales. There's a good wrestler, and a bad wrestler whom he confronts at the end. In between, the good wrestler has a love interest or a child he has to protect.  Bill would usually make the good wrestler a backwoods type, or a convict. And sometimes, instead of a waif, he'd have the wrestler protecting an idiot manchild.  The studio always hated that. Oh, some of the scripts were so... spirited!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Well... THIS.

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: You wrote his scripts for him?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Well, the basic ideas were frequently his-

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: You wrote Bill's scripts!  Jesus Christ, you wrote his  what about before that?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Before what?

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Before Bill came to Hollywood.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Well, Bill was ALWAYS the author, so to speak-

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: What do you mean so to speak?! Audrey, how long have you been his... secretary?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Barton, I think we should concentrate on OUR little project-

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: I want to know how many of Bill's books you wrote!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Barton!

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: I want to know!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Barton, honestly, only the last couple-

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: Hah!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: And my input was mostly... EDITORIAL, really, when he'd been drinking-

turns.speaker: BARTON
turns.text: I'll bet. Jesus  "The grand productive days." What a goddamn phony.

turns.speaker: MAYHEW
turns.text: If I close m'eyes I can almost smell the live oak.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: That's hamburger grease, Bill.

turns.speaker: MAYHEW
turns.text: Well, m'olfactory's turnin' womanish on me  lyin' and deceitful...

turns.speaker: MAYHEW
turns.text: ...This'll sometimes help.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: That doesn't help anything, Bill.

turns.speaker: MAYHEW
turns.text: So now I'm s'posed to roll over like an ol' bitch dog gettin' ger belly scratched.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Bill 

turns.speaker: MAYHEW
turns.text: M'honey pretends to be impatient with me, Barton, but she'll put up with anything.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Not anything, Bill. Don't test me.
